intro: Corydalis incisa f. candida, commonly known as the white-flowered corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits containing numerous small, elliptical seeds. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and shaded borders in horticulture.
